column4: hi all! with what can i open a .db file so that i can read that?

i am building a kolab server and for some reason that i understand it keeps writing back a misconfiguration that i did a few days ago and as that configuration is nowhere to find there are only the .db files left where it could be in...
'file' is a tool, it should tell you what filetype a given file is.  I'm guessing those are sqlite files, but they could be anything.
sqlite was also my suspicion but i will check, just a sec pls
access.db: Berkeley DB (Hash, version 8, native byte-order)
does yuck mean something like gulp or is that a tool? :D
hey dude, long time no see:) do you happen to know where to the entries for dvd/cdrom drives have gone in fstab and why there are no more directories in /media to mount them to?
They should be there, that hasn't changed in Lucid.
but this is like my 5th different installatin where all of that is just gone
/media is total 0 and fstab lacks every hint that the computers have one or more drives..
